references.paper_title: A simple framework for contrastive learning of visual representations
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of contrastive learning, providing a simple yet effective framework that is widely used in many subsequent works, making it highly influential to the current research.

references.paper_title: Momentum contrast for unsupervised visual representation learning
references.reason: This paper introduces the Momentum Contrast method, a significant advancement in contrastive learning that improves upon previous approaches and has significantly influenced the field.

references.paper_title: Bootstrap your own latent - a new approach to self-supervised learning
references.reason: This paper presents a novel self-supervised learning method that achieves state-of-the-art performance on various benchmarks, demonstrating the effectiveness of self-supervised learning and its potential in computer vision.
This work introduces SimSiam, a simple yet effective contrastive learning framework that achieves strong performance and provides insights into the design of contrastive learning methods.

references.paper_title: Indiscriminate poisoning attacks on unsupervised contrastive learning
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it is one of the first to study the vulnerability of contrastive learning to poisoning attacks, directly addressing the security concerns that motivate this current paper.
